diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Severe congenital hyperinsulinism caused by a mutation in the Kir6.2 subunit of the ATP-sensitive potassium channel
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the identification of a homozygous missense mutation, H259R, in the Kir6.2 subunit leading to channel non-functionality and impaired trafficking. The patient's presentation included macrosomia and severe hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia, confirmed by genetic analysis and cellular studies demonstrating decreased surface expression and abolition of KATP currents.
